definition: to check/to examine/to inspect/to exercise restraint
to research/to check/to investigate/to examine/to refer to/to look up (e.g. a word in a dictionary)
station/to stand/to halt/to stop/branch of a company or organization/website

sentences.english: Following the closure of the checkpoint, prices of commodities especially those from Thailand have increased.
sentences.chinese: 大平檢查站關閉後，物價尤其是來自泰國的商品高漲。

sentences.english: Thousands of people streamed past the now moribund check points.
sentences.chinese: 數千德國人湧到行將就木的檢查站。

sentences.english: Eight policemen have been killed in an attack on a police checkpoint in Mexico.
sentences.chinese: 八名警察在墨西哥一個警察檢查站遭遇的襲擊中遇難。

sentences.english: At dusk, a car stops at a checkpoint in Afghanistan.
sentences.chinese: 黃昏時分，一輛車停在了一個阿富汗的檢查站。

sentences.english: And the groups of armed young men stopped cars at checkpoints every few blocks throughout the city.
sentences.chinese: 年輕人阻止在每隔幾個街區設立的檢查站都停了車。

sentences.english: The guys in the first checkpoint were friendly but not overly so.
sentences.chinese: 第一個檢查站的人很友好，但是絕不諂媚。

sentences.english: The integrated weighing stations check the weight of the vials before and after filling.
sentences.chinese: 綜合檢查站稱重重量的小瓶灌裝之前和之後。

sentences.english: As we arrived at the check-point the soldiers came forward guns raised.
sentences.chinese: 到了檢查站，士兵舉着槍走向我們。

sentences.english: Every 100 meters there is a checkpoint.
sentences.chinese: 每隔100米就有一個檢查站。

sentences.english: But they arrested another man who had arrived at the check-point at the same time we had.
sentences.chinese: 但是另一個和我們同時通過檢查站的人卻被抓了起來。

sentences.english: While this image appeared at the former location of Checkpoint Charlie in Berlin.
sentences.chinese: 這幅圖像出現在柏林以前的查理檢查站地區。

sentences.english: These camps and roadblocks are the checkpoints of violence.
sentences.chinese: 這些營寨和障礙是暴利檢查站。

sentences.english: Checkpoint Charlie was designated as the single crossing point for foreigners and members of the Allied forces.
sentences.chinese: 查理檢查站是用來給外國人，同盟軍通過的唯一通道。

sentences.english: There are checkpoints with soldiers everywhere, and they often demand money.
sentences.chinese: 到處都有士兵把手的檢查站，他們往往需要錢。

sentences.english: Your hand baggage will be examined at the check-point.
sentences.chinese: 你的手提包要在旅客檢查站檢查。

definition: Chaochou town in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
Yanpu township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
Kaoshu township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
to access/to transfer passengers between two railway lines
Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Kuomintang/same as 孫中山|孙中山
